question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the greatest number of Sundays that can occur in the first $49$ days of a year?
inference:
We have $49$ days in the first $7$ weeks of a year.
We are looking for the number of Sundays in those first $49$ days.

Since the first day of the year can be any day of the week, there are $7$ possible scenarios.

We can look at 7 different cases depending on what day of the week the first day of the year is.

**Case 1:** The first day of the year is Sunday, then there will be $1, 8, 15, 22, 29, 36, 43$ as Sundays.

**Case 2:** The first day of the year is Monday, then there will be $2, 9, 16, 23, 30, 37, 44$ as Sundays.

**Case 3:** The first day of the year is Tuesday, then there will be $3, 10, 17, 24, 31, 38, 45$ as Sundays.

**Case 4:** The first day of the year is Wednesday, then there will be $4, 11, 18, 25, 32, 39, 46$ as Sundays.

**Case 5:** The first day of the year is Thursday, then there will be $5, 12, 19, 26, 33, 40, 47$ as Sundays.

**Case 6:** The first day of the year is Friday, then there will be $6, 13, 20, 27, 34, 41, 48$ as Sundays.

**Case 7:** The first day of the year is Saturday, then there will be $7, 14, 21, 28, 35, 42, 49$ as Sundays.

In all the cases, we can see that there are $7$ Sundays in the first $49$ days of the year.

**Final Answer: $\boxed{7}.$ I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth: 49 days is seven full weeks, so there are always $\boxed{7}$ Sundays.
